Message: Grita told me everything.

About how she
really was an angel.
That she’d fought
and lost to a demon.

And that she’d lost her memories
from the impact of crashing
to the ground.

She even told me that
I’d accidentally enacted a miracle.

“Us angels have the power to
grant the wishes of humans.

When you wished to save me,
the power of the miracle lying
dormant inside me reacted,

and it enacted a miracle that
drove off the cursed creature.”

“Miracles require giving up
something as big as
the wish in exchange—

something precious to
the one enacting it.

For you, Lumica...it’ll likely be
one day’s worth of memories with
the person you hold most dear.”

“I-If it was to save you, Grita,
forgetting one day is nothing!

We can just make even more
fun memories in the future!”

“Yeah. That’s...
what I wanted for us, too...”

Grita averted her eyes.
That’s when I noticed...

that Grita was slowly
fading away.

“This was the only way to
save you from certain death,
Lumica.”
“We exist to grant wishes.

It is forbidden for us
to grant our own.

“...No...
That’s not what I want...!
God, please!
Take back Grita’s wish!
Only save Grita...!”

“I can’t let that happen.
Because, a world without you,
is a world I can’t love.”

As Grita said so,
she flashed the prettiest smile
I’d ever seen.
